title: merging contours
content:
is it possible to embolden type without the contours merging. It’s a bit of a pain in the arse, though in places, I can see why it’s necessary. There should be a tick box option...

 [‹ Fontlab: Font Naming Made Easy?](http://web.archive.org/web/20080107081826/http:/www.typophile.com/node/17516 "Go to previous forum topic") [VOLT & Ship Font & Strip ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080107081826/http:/www.typophile.com/node/17480 "Go to next forum topic")
author: dux

comments.content: Ok, so after a lot of searching, reading manuals all I’ve come up with is this (and it’s far from ideal) — if a contour is broken, you can still embolden it without merging occuring to that particular contour, and anything that overlaps it. The result isn’t exactly the same as a normal bold transformation, as in normal circumstances at a point of intersection, there needs to be a node that sits on a unit. Makes sense. Now is there a way of doing this that does makes sense..!
